post.body: I met a man standing for election to the US House of Representatives, Shane Hazel. He had given a sort of small campaign speech and I we talked for a while after the event. He's real old-fashioned, constitutionalist guy, but he loves "disruptive" technology, and mentioned blockchain specifically in his speech, so I was sure to tell him all about ZeroNet and how great it is -w-
Senran Kagura: Peach Beach Splash comes out swinging with a few hundred dollars worth of DLC costumes. owo

I played some of Fullbright's "Where the Water Tastes Like Wine." They're the guys who made Gone Home a while back, so i was expecting at least a little "diverse" pandering and stuff, and it was there but not tasteless or overbearing, so I didn't mind. HOWEVER, they have these little "side stories" written by third parties. Lo, and behold: one of them was written by Silverstring Media, the group that hosts all kinds of nutty SJW retreat workshops on "State oppression jenga" and "dismantling masculinity." They also DDOS and DOXX their opponents, and were most well known for calling all Total Biscuit viewers "scum" and claiming that "gaming is dead." These days they occupy themselves by writing several pages of articles about how video games should be used to fight right wing politics. And amazingly enough, the shameless losers called their side story's main character Quinn, as in Zoe Quinn.
I spent all of my spring break taking photos of my cats. I feel very accomplished; they're more than happy to sit still for photos, most of the day.
One of these days, I'm going to drop $210 on a DM42 calculator ... One day.
I'm enjoying Metal Gear Survive and there's nothing you can do about it

comment.body: I used to really be into Dogecoin, mainly because of its CPU mining. It had (probably still has) an amazing community and it was just really fun to be in it when things were on the up and up: the Jamaican bobsled team, the NASCAR race. I think I fell out of it a couple years ago for my own reasons or something ... I checked the subreddit for it once kinda recently and was glad to see it's still around. ^^
